website_summaries.verdict: The MSR Miniworks can pump up to a liter of clean water per minute, but you'll need to keep the ceramic filter clean to do so.
pros: Meets NSF protocol P231 for removal of 99.9% of bacteria and protozoa
Delivers clean taste and odor-free water
Pumps at a rate of 1 liter per minute
Compatible with many wide mouth water bottles and hydration bladders
One replaceable filter cartridge treats up to 2,000 liters of water
cons: If pumping slows down, give the filter element a light scrub

customer_reviews.title: Best water filter I've used
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 different water filter devices (sounds crazy because it is) because I wanted to pit these things against eachother. I bought a Sawyer gravity, a katadyn gravity 6L, life straw, and the MSR MINIWORKS EX. If I go on a trip by myself I will be bringing the MSR. If I go on a grouo trip I will be bringing the MSR and the Katadyn. You could bring the MSR for a group and be just fine but you'll be doing a lot of pumping. I would 100% recommend this filter. It was recommened to me by a person who takes regular BWCA trips. He has had his for 8 years.
customer_reviews.author: M4NNING

customer_reviews.title: first it is heavier than I would like, second the amount of water discharged per stroke ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a backpacking trip across the Olympic Mountains. Bought this unit because it is serviceable, and can be cleaned in the field. It has a few drawbacks, first it is heavier than I would like, second the amount of water discharged per stroke is a little low. It takes about 100 pumps to fill a Nalgene bottle. That said, this is a very solid unit with few drawbacks.
customer_reviews.author: matt pierjok

customer_reviews.title: wont leave home with out it !
customer_reviews.text: this water filter was amazing. the water we filtered with this tasted amazing and had no foul smell of any kind. the construction of the filter its self is great. the pump handle feels sturdy and not cheap and flimsy. i was able to operate this pump one handed to get video of me using it. effort required to push water through the filter was minimal in my situation and filled my 1000 mL nalgene bottle several times with absolutely no problems at all. I also never got sick from drinking the water. all in all.. this water filter has become a valuable piece of gear for my kit and i will never go on adventures with out it again.
customer_reviews.author: John p.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the risk.
customer_reviews.text: May work for you but not for us. This system is not great at filtering a lot of water without having to clean the filter, 40-50oz max. I have an older MSR water filter that will filter gallons without issue but though I’d save some size and weight with this one. On our hikes we can’t sacrifice not having a working filtration system. Definitely going back to my reliable system!
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Broke second use on a 5 day canyon hike and had to rely on other people for drinking water.
customer_reviews.author: IShopAmazon

customer_reviews.title: I have used thing like crazy. The water is always fresh and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used thing like crazy. The water is always fresh and I have never been ill or sick. I fits perfect in my backpack. It is heavy than the ulatra light versions, like the straws. But I like the fact it attaches to my water bottle and I do various types of treatments to the water, drops or UV light. Small and compact, the bag it comes in hold everything in place and allows air to move around the unit. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H

customer_reviews.title: Keep it clean
customer_reviews.text: I use the mini works once or twice a year. Each time filtering no more than 10 to 12 liters. I like the fact that it adapts to most any water bottle. I use Nalgene products. It works great. The one thing I would emphasize is that you need to keep the filter clean. Take your scrub pad with you. If it starts to slow down, or gets difficult to pump, take a minute to clean it. It makes a world of difference. Also clean and dry it after each use and before storing regardless of how much it was used.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Sucks, great work out though
customer_reviews.text: Sucks, great work out though. Perfect for frustrating your camping partner and then being stuck backpacking with them and this terrible filter. Get a platypus gravityworks and never struggle for water again, best backpacking purchase that could ever be made.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Rausch

customer_reviews.title: I want to love this filter but cannot...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second MSR miniworks. My first filter worked great but it got lost. I had only used my new filter once and then on a backpacking trip, last weekend, it stopped working. We wasted hours trying to get it going again, but no water would go through the filter. I see others complain about this same problem and I don't know how to fix it other than take a risk on another filter. I am now seriously looking at other brands. I love MSR, but the miniworks is not dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Rock

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning the filter is really easy.  1 liter in around 2 minutes is easily sustainable.
customer_reviews.text: I hike where mountain streams are plentiful. My brother has the guardian. It fills bottles faster and filters viruses. I felt like this filter did great. Fills water bottles and only needs to be cleaned after 10 liters or so. Cleaning is quick and easy. I will still buy a guardian for really dirty water. All the life straws and sawyers are light but do not produce enough water. If you wanna fill bottles the pumps work! Water tast good, can't be happier. They need to make a mini guardian!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Miniworks
customer_reviews.text: The mini works does its job and well. However, it does require some messing with to get it pumping good. Its definitely slower than some other filters out there but having used it next to other filters the water it produces is clearer and taste better. Not sure if I would buy again honestly, will up date this review after getting some more field time with it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S.

customer_reviews.title: Great filter if you have the room or for longer trips
customer_reviews.text: Great filter. Works well. I trust it completely. Put a pre-filter on the end to avoid clogging the filter. Only downside is it's a bit bulky. But essential for longer trips. Shorter trips I use a Sawyer or a Lifestraw. Convenient because can be used with Nalgene bottles.
customer_reviews.author: LNE

customer_reviews.title: in fairly clear water this filter is only good for about 64oz before the filter cartridge needs cleaning ...
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this filter incredibly slow, in fairly clear water this filter is only good for about 64oz before the filter cartridge needs cleaning making it a hassle to use. You'll definitely spend more time pumping and cleaning this filter than you will enjoying your time outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: High Sierras
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We just used it for a few days in the High Sierras. We filtered water for 8 people for 3 days. We had to clean the filter element about every 8L based on the water we were using. Great piece of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: great pump
customer_reviews.text: if this one lasts as long as the original one I purchased more than 20 years ago (and still use) it will be fine. One time, in band camp, we were hiking across Yellowstone. My MSR (original) waterworks was the only pump that kept pumping while other brand's pumps clogged fast. It saved the whole trip for the other hikers with me.
customer_reviews.author: globiejam

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!!!! Buy this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Have used it on many kayak trips, never need to take water since I'm in it. The only issue is that you have to make sure you clean this thing after every expedition. I would recommend buying a tube of food based silicon instead of the small tube in the maintenance kit that is a seperate purchase to lube up everything after cleaning it out.
customer_reviews.author: Battleforutopia

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but worth it
customer_reviews.text: This was my main pump for backpacking during the last five years. It is, to my knowledge, the only pump on the market that can be completely repaired in the field. The construction is totally solid and I have yet to experience significant failure. I also bought the repair kit, which contains all the gaskets and spare parts, and keep it with the pump. The downsides to this are weight and cleaning. You can get a more lightweight pump. That said, if your pump fails in the wilderness you want to be able to fix it. It does collect a lot of sediment and needs to be cleaned regularly for optimum performance.
customer_reviews.author: Foofienugget

customer_reviews.title: Nice and small
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a chance to use this in the outdoors yet, but when I prepped it and it seems to work fine. One thing did happen. Maybe it was normal, but after following the instructions for preparing it for use, I used tap water in my sink. After everything dried out the inside of the hose turned a kind of white opaque color. Which does not seem to have made any difference to function or taste. Other than that, it seems like a solid product! Up date, after reading one of the comments about wanter quality, I went back and tried it with filtered water and there was no residue.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: This has been in the big out bag for a year or two but when a hurricane hit the east coast our drinking water needed to be filtered. I had no issue filtering enough water for my family and a few neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit Camelbak Hydration packs, but still a good filter
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best portable filters available, and works well, fairly maintenance free, but it does require proper use. Unfortunately it does NOT fit my Camelbak hydration pack - I was hoping it would. It will fit wide-mouth Nalgene water bottles, so not a real problem. Just don't buy it thinking it will fit hydration packs. Actually better to filter into a Nalgene and purify with Polar Pure in that before pouring into hydration packs anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Safari

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it! Buy a Katadyn.
customer_reviews.text: This filter is junk. It broke the very first time I used it. It needs an umbrella flange replacement, that would cost me an additional $35. No thanks, going try and return it. We went out and bought at Katadyn! It is a much better filter and pumps about 4 times faster than the MSR. Side note - my brother in law bought the same one. His stopped filter on our second trip this summer. He is going to send his back as well! Zero 🌟🌟🌟🌟’s
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Cole

customer_reviews.title: Handy water filter for backpacking!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this filter on multiple day backpacking trips and it's great! It's easy to use, easy to clean, and not too heavy. The water intake is very light and floats on the surface of the water, so that can get a little annoying trying to keep the tube in a good place in the water while holding the water bottle and also pumping the filter. I think this is a fairly common problem with water filters, though.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed with the performance of the MSR microfilter
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with the performance of the MSR microfilter. It did not perform very well at all. However, it should be noted that our group was in Ontario, Canada on a fly-in fishing trip. The water in the area has a very high mineral content that kept clogging up the filter within 5 to ten minutes of filtration. Perhaps in other areas the filter would work better.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Keller

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment to have in the bag.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic buy! Used it on a trip to Navajo Lake last fall. I've never tasted water so fresh an clean in my life.... but the source was pretty good too! Will try it in more "questionable" situations and follow up.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I went for a 3 day backpacking trip in by glacial springs straight out of the mountain snow melt. I used this product 3 times, no sediment or scum or debris or detritus was present in the water. Still this thing clogged, or slowed. Not the filter its self, but the section where water is sucked into the core of the device in a whirlwind. This is insane and must be a manufacturer defect. I looked into this product heavily, and am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sue H

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: Failed after a single liter of water filtered. Worse than useless.
customer_reviews.author: Solovino

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: IMHO, this is the best value in a water filter. I backpack, canoe, camp, and this has been a mainstay for years. Parts are readily available, although I've never needed any, and it works. The ceramic discs are cleanable, and can be a bit fragile. They will clog if you try to filter really dirty water, so find the cleanest source you can and you'll be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Truthsayer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, and very durable
customer_reviews.text: As with most MSR products, the miniworks microfilter is efficient, and rugged enough to toss in your pack and not worry about it breaking. About the size of a water bottle, it fits into the side pocket of my backpack without a problem. To use it, you simply tosse the syphon tube into a strea, lake, or any other body of water, and pump it directly into your Camelbak, or any other water carrying container. Works great, but to fill a 3 liter hydration pack make get a little tedious. I highly recommend this model, as the ceramic filter will last you years, and the pump itself will not break under regualr use.
customer_reviews.author: Yolo

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous value in many ways
customer_reviews.text: Small. Light. Easy to maintain. Easy to use. I could go on and on. Originally I bought a LIFESAVER 4000 or something. It was bulky. Heavy. Finicky. A lot of "don't do this" and "don't do that" in the instructions. At the end of the day the lifesaver was not a practical solution for me. I found the answer in this. Great tasting water through this (from a muddy puddle to test it out). I bought a spare filter and a maintenance and spare parts kit. Everything fits in the included bag. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: sfoote

customer_reviews.title: Best value for money water purifier
customer_reviews.text: I've only owned this a month and already it's paid for itself when I failed to take sufficient water on a hike on the weekend and used the MSR MiniWorks to pump and filter water from a creek. With running water, the tube intake and floater kept getting washed back to shore - still would have worked, but I threw the tube around a rock to hold it in place while I pumped. Easy to disassemble and clean although would appreciate tips on drying the plastic tube as that takes about 3 days to dry so I can re-pack. Got the spare ceramic filter and maintenance kit as recommended by others here.
customer_reviews.author: Nathanael

customer_reviews.title: But the water filtered with this always tastes nice and clean
customer_reviews.text: I used my friends MSR miniworks EX system on 3 day hiking trip before buying my own. Friends with other systems complained about the taste of their water. But the water filtered with this always tastes nice and clean. I love how this can be completely disassembled when needed. Just an outstanding filter system.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Clean water fast
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my son to use on hunting trip, him and 2 others used it and it worked GREAT. He said that the trick is just don’t get in a hurry. Just nice slow pumps. Likes it better than his old system.
customer_reviews.author: BJB

customer_reviews.title: A bit slow but does great.
customer_reviews.text: I just spent 5 days on North Manatou Island where our only water came from the lake. A friend had the Kat hiker filter which was much faster than this one, but his water always had a slight muddy aftertaste. I had the MSR mini which was much harder and slower to pump even brand new but my water was always crisp and zero lake taste. I'll pump slower and harder any day to have good clean water.
customer_reviews.author: Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Great for the whole group
customer_reviews.text: We’ve taken this on many backpacking trips and this filter has been great for the whole group. Easy to use and clean and maintain. Glad to have a good reliable water filter that everyone can benefit from.
customer_reviews.author: JennyJ

customer_reviews.title: ... it's stupidly simple to operate and to service and super reliable. Moreover
customer_reviews.text: It's a little heavier than other filters but it's stupidly simple to operate and to service and super reliable. Moreover, it fits a wide-mouth nalgene bottle perfectly (as well as my backpack bladder and my camelback) and those things balance out any weight issues for me. I've carried mine all over the VA portion of the AT and similar trail systems.
customer_reviews.author: wlg

customer_reviews.title: Trust worthy
customer_reviews.text: It pumps a little bit of air in with the water keeping a constant fairly even pressure in the pump also uses mechanical advantage for easier pumping it is larger and heavier than other filters but I trust it a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Mudge

customer_reviews.title: Drops at a time
customer_reviews.text: Got this filter for a 6 day kayaking trip with a group and you can imagine we drank a lot of water. A friend of mine had the Katadyn Hiker Pro: ( and could filter all of our group's water bottles before I could finish filling up my 48oz Nalgene. The Katadyn has the pressure of a tap and the MSR has the pressure of a leaky faucet. Every time I am on the down stroke of the pump a bit of air goes back into the inlet straw causing the next pump to not fill the already small water chamber to its potential. I am returning this filter and getting the Katadyn instead.
customer_reviews.author: R Moore

customer_reviews.title: A very effective water filter in a compact size.
customer_reviews.text: From what I am told, this is the same system the Marine Corps. uses in the field. This is a great little purifier, does an amazing job purifying scummy water. the bottom has the ability to screw onto water bottles with matching thread for easy transfer of water. The unit is small and relatively light, making it easy and a good choice for backpacking. The MSR miniWorks is a great filter and it's reputation is well known.
customer_reviews.author: Product Reviews International

customer_reviews.title: Water taste does not improve.
customer_reviews.text: I just took this new filter to Mexico and tried filtering a gallon of tap water. It tasted so bad afterwards that nobody would drink it . We had to purchase bottled water instead for the rest of the time there.
customer_reviews.author: MurrayUtah

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product!. Exceeded expectations price, quality, and service --very happy with it.Great product!.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Worked nice
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a canoe trip with my kids. Water was good. Nobody got sick. Put a coffee filter over the end to extend the filter
customer_reviews.author: S. B.

customer_reviews.title: Over priced, heavy, and clogs quickly
customer_reviews.text: For the premium price this filter sells I would expect it to at least function at ease. It clogs almost every fill, a bit heavy for the backpacking trip and overpriced
customer_reviews.author: Pasha

customer_reviews.title: A great filter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one for backpacking approximately 5 years ago and have used it during our trips into the Uinta Mountains and the Wind Rivers and it is by far the best filter I have used. Not long ago I purchased a second one for my son so we would always have a backup just in case and they have both worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Roberts

customer_reviews.title: For Go/Hicking bag
customer_reviews.text: Item came as described, arriving quickly. Packaged as if bought of shelf in store. I have not used the item yet, nor plan to in immediate future. It is for an emergency situation only. With it I purchased a spare filter and rebuild kit (if I have to ever use those then the s***really hit the fan!) It was a tough choice, but after several reviews of other filters/purifiers expert and customer reviews I settled on this one. It seems (though mostly plastic) to be sturdily build.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Parkhurst

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the most lightweight of filters but it is lighter than others on the market and very good at what it does. This filter isn't something you'll need for an overnight trip but would be a dream on a week-long trek with a few people.
customer_reviews.author: Shack_man

customer_reviews.title: Pumps 1 liter 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Great pump good flow. Will know more if I get another filter. But this one seems to work great and fits generic open mouthed water bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Tucsonian

customer_reviews.title: A Must for Any Backpacker/ Adventurer!
customer_reviews.text: Works excellently with Nalgene water bottles!! Keeps water clean for drinking from any stream! I have taken it backpacking to many places including Mammoth Cave Nat'l Park, Kentucky, Red River Gorge, Kentucky, Zaleski State Forest, Ohio, Shawnee State Forest, Ohio, and Dolly Sods, West Virginia. It is my lifeline when it comes to drinking water for the trail! I would recommend to any hiker or backpacker!!
customer_reviews.author: Avid Backpacker 2007

customer_reviews.title: Good but seems low quality
customer_reviews.text: Had to boil the filter after about 2 nalgen fills. A little cumbersome but worked great after on its first outing. Hopefully it holds up, quality seems cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Great filter
customer_reviews.text: Like everything else I've ever purchased from MSR, this is a quality and functional item. It is a bit on the heavy side, but I really like having the serviceable filter to restore good flow (it is really really easy to service). Water tastes great and the filter lasts a long time. I love how seamlessly it integrates with my Dromedary. If weight's a real concern, just use Aquamira. If you want a filter, I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and used it on a 4 day backpacking trip in the Grand Teton's in Wyoming. Among our group there was 3 different water filters, this was the fastest to pump by far. It does have to be cleaned fairly regularly, but that doesn't take long and is a pretty easy process. I love my MSR filter. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Beukelman

customer_reviews.title: Kind of annoying to use but gets he job done
customer_reviews.text: Kind of annoying to use but gets he job done. Compared the clarity of water pumped from this vs. A Sawyer Squeeze and this was more clear. A bit heavy for ultralight packers but definitely works well if you don't mind sacrificing a few minutes to pump water.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: a comparison based on experience
customer_reviews.text: In the past I've had a katadyne and I've had this one here. This one outperformed it's more functional and the price is excellent
customer_reviews.author: charles obryan

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. This was purchased as a 2nd ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. This was purchased as a 2nd filter/pump and we got the same as before. Our 15 year old MiniWorks is still going strong too!!!
customer_reviews.author: KJ in Iowa

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My Scout troop tested the MSR MiniWorks EX Microfilter Water Filter with well water that was drinkable but had lots of iron. After running it thru this filter the iron taste was gone. Can't wait to try on our backpacking trip.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Caulkett

customer_reviews.title: The filter is easy to use and can fill up your canister (e
customer_reviews.text: The filter is easy to use and can fill up your canister (e.g. Nalgene bottle) quickly. It's also nice to see the water flowing, due to the transparent red plastic top, as you pump to ensure it's operation. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Chad the Runner

customer_reviews.title: Really nice water filter.
customer_reviews.text: Wow this thing works great. I bought this last year and I used it all hunting season for fresh water.
customer_reviews.author: blynch35

customer_reviews.title: but followed the directions with regards to priming it after unpacking it and worked great as far as functionality
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had the need to use it in the wild yet, but followed the directions with regards to priming it after unpacking it and worked great as far as functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Petsche

customer_reviews.title: It worked good.
customer_reviews.text: I used this filter on a hike around Maui, it came in handy and never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Frank  from  South Kingstown, RI

customer_reviews.title: essential backcountry gear
customer_reviews.text: this is an awesome filter. attaches directly to nalgene water bottles. flow rate is good and water tastes very pure and clean. easy to use and clean, will last a long time with good maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: dmh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I'm definitely an MSR fan, having purchased two liquid fuel stoves, two tents and misc camping accessories. I really like this filter, it seems well designed and serviceable. I have mine mainly for emergency use at home, so I'll never wear it out. I've read of many people using it on expeditions, but I've not used it like that.
customer_reviews.author: Adventure and Coffee

customer_reviews.title: How did I survive on long hikes without it?
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. My friends had his for over 20 years.. yup. Drank water from a stream, still kicking.
customer_reviews.author: edward

customer_reviews.title: Clogs really easy but with some patience and the green scouring pad ...
customer_reviews.text: Clogs really easy but with some patience and the green scouring pad it can be cleaned easy. No Giardia For us out in the back country.
customer_reviews.author: Family

customer_reviews.title: After like 2-3 liters it needs to be cleaned
customer_reviews.text: Get clogged faster than I was expecting. After like 2-3 liters it needs to be cleaned. - Still does the job
customer_reviews.author: marie-eve

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I was a product manager, traveling all over, sometimes to remote regions without good drinking water. Once while in South America I contracted giardia, a nasty waterborne bug that causes severe distress. It took nine months to recover fully. Never again. I am on my second MiniWorks and have given another to a friend who is an avid hiker. It's lightweight, you can take it on a plane in your carry-on, and it's rugged enough to handle travel. The bottom fits a standard water bottle so you just place the hose into the best water you can find, pump the handle and you get filtered water. I fill up my own water bottles when traveling and take them with me.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Keller

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid
customer_reviews.text: I have used this several times now, in lakes, rivers, and ponds. It does great, though you have to work for it. The water tastes great and I like the cleanable filter. TIP: if you rubber band a coffee filter or handkerchief around the inlet you'll prefilter the water, saving some life on the filter and making it a little easier to pump.
customer_reviews.author: dude

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: This is a great filter. Easy to clean. Pumps good. Just a little heavy for backpaxking but for canoeing it was great.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Clements

customer_reviews.title: It fits on wide mouth nalgene bottles for easy purification and water storage
customer_reviews.text: It fits on wide mouth nalgene bottles for easy purification and water storage. I have yet to need a new filter after 2 years. Light weight, great for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Lambeth

customer_reviews.title: This is the best bang for your buck water filter
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I haven't filtered through this is my pee. I have filtered water out of 3 inch deep puddle with the most stagnant water you'll find and drank it. The filter is amazing, it didn't leave any weird tastes in the water or any particulate. My only gripe is, it's slow and it's heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Wood

customer_reviews.title: BOMB PROOF AND EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after a bad experience with water in South America. This product took water that was the color of tea and pumped out clear tasteless water. The ability to break it down and clean the filter in the field was great as well. It pumps pretty well but does require frequent filter cleanings. This is actually a civilian version of the one used by the U.S. Marine Corps. That says more than any long review ever could. The reliability and toughness, paired with the field maintainability is why they chose this product.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Too Slow!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Read all the great reviews, ordered it for a backpacking trip with my grandson. Took it to Dinkey Creek Lakes in CA. elevation 4,000 ft. Had to pump FOREVER to get enough water to fill a bottle. Guess it was a problem with being at a higher altitude.
customer_reviews.author: PapaJohn454

customer_reviews.title: Great back packing filter
customer_reviews.text: Great back packing filter. The pump screwed right onto my platypus water bag which made filtering the water super easy because we did not having to worrie about holding the bottle and pumping at the same time . Very happy with this filter
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Best water filter i could ask for. Great for backpacking
customer_reviews.author: IT Guy

customer_reviews.title: Still standing
customer_reviews.text: I've owned various MSR water filters over the years. They seem to work great - I have gotten sick or died yet. I like the screw bottom on this one - you can easily screw a bottle or canteen onto the bottom. It did seem a little bit slower (in water output) then other filters I've owned. Or maybe I"m just getting old.
customer_reviews.author: EJH

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good pump but took a lot of energy to filter water for a company of 3.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksey K.

customer_reviews.title: Absolute waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Took this pump with me to the boundary waters for a week long trip. It barely worked. It is a lie that it pumps one liter a minute. It took thirty minutes to fill up one Nalgene bottle. Absolute waste of money. Very disappointed. Would not reccomend this pump.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Faulty filter
customer_reviews.text: Filter base is separating from the ceramic filter after just a couple of uses.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: I love This filter
customer_reviews.text: I love This filter, so far I have filtered about 25 gallons and it has worked perfect. They quality of the water is awesome; however try to avoid filtering water that is not clear it will clog the filter very fast.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in spring fed streams in Idaho. I wouldn't attempt continual use in murky or nasty water because the filter would clog up extremely fast.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Braaten

customer_reviews.title: It is a good product, but too much work & too many ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product, but too much work & too many parts for backpacking. Went with a simpler product.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Alonso

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly when we went backpacking and needed more water. Quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: tinabina

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Of all of the water filters I"ve tried this is the best...The filter seems to clogg up the quickest of any of them, but but you can get 3 to 4 quarts before it needs cleaning, The maintanenece is easy, break down is easy, and if you have ever tried other water filters for backpacking you know the water is normally "Chemical" tasting and "fake" But the water from my MSR. Tastes the best, it tastes like water, clean water and I don't mind the more frequent cleaning for this reason. I have officially retired my catadyne as an emergency only and the loaner backpacking filter. It really doesn't hold a candle to my MSR.
customer_reviews.author: kayak fiend

customer_reviews.title: Efficient, easy to use, GREAT product
customer_reviews.text: Quick, efficient, easy way to purify water in the backcountry. Recently bought and used this microfilter on a week-long hike in the backcountry and loved it. Very easy to use and delivers delicious and clean water. BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Brad K.

customer_reviews.title: I tried to like it, but it simply doesn't hold up to the competition.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this product. I love MSR products, including the,,,, and. But the MiniWorks EX leaves a lot to be desired. Sure, it is field maintainable and robustly built. But it is painfully slow and more troublesome to pump than competing filters on the market. If I am going to pump, I will use the Sweetwater filter (now owned by MSR). Otherwise, I prefer the AutoFlow or a.
customer_reviews.author: J.I.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: My son and I recently used the MSR Miniworks EX on a Boy Scout backpacking trip. I purchased this based on a recommendation of other Scouts in our troop. The filter worked excellently, allowing us to stay well hydrated on the entire trip. The cleanup afterwards was quick and easy due to the design of the unit. I am very pleased with this purchase and would highly recommend it to anyone considering a portable purification unit. We are storing it in our emergency "go bag" in case of disaster so that no matter what happens my family will have access to pure and clean water.
customer_reviews.author: H Songer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't pump nearly as fast as advertised. I was ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't pump nearly as fast as advertised. I was in crystal clear water, and still was pumping 1L half an hour. When it's 102 degrees outside it makes a missable trip.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Didn't crap my pants
customer_reviews.text: Didn't crap my pants. I mean, thats what you really want in one of these....right? Good value. Easy to pack.
customer_reviews.author: Nic Westendorf

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great buy. Purchased over the holidays and got this unit for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: J. P.

customer_reviews.title: Bought this filter as an addition to my Florida hurricane ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this filter as an addition to my Florida hurricane preparedness kit. I can literally put the intake hose into a mud puddle and get clean drinking water from it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Reliable equipment
customer_reviews.text: Have not used in the field yet,is of good design though.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S Gilbrook

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well and water tastes great. Comes apart easily for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: L. Zilliox

customer_reviews.title: Compact and great for your bug out or camping kit
customer_reviews.text: Compact and great for your bug out or camping kit. threads onto standard water bottles and camel back style bladders. A must have for filling containers with drinking water.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: No need to boil water
customer_reviews.text: we used the water filter when there was a boil water notice for our city. It worked better than boiling water and it can be used for camping.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great filter in the past.
customer_reviews.text: I've just had a bad experience with this filter. But it does sort of work still so hence the 2 stars. I work professionally outside and have used hundreds of this exact filter. This filter just never flowed water right, and after contacting MSR multiple times, I was told I am just not scrubbing the filter clean enough after purchasing them new and need a wire brush to do it right. That sounds silly. So I say this is a good filter but if you happen to get a bad one, they won't stick up your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Sucks!
customer_reviews.text: Worst filter ever seriously! 100 slow pumps for a cup of water, 20 minutes to fill up a gal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clean water
customer_reviews.text: Great filter for long hunts in the moutains. Only bad thing is it freezes up in cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: scott albright

customer_reviews.title: Was a good filter and built quite sturdily
customer_reviews.text: Was a good filter and built quite sturdily. Filtered our water for a weeks hunting trip without any issues, although if you are filtering from a fast stream, take the foam float off from around the intake. It is not fast though, takes about 5-7 minutes to fill a 32oz Nalgene bottle. Great purifier for the price
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R. Trueblood

customer_reviews.title: Chisos Mountains!!
customer_reviews.text: If you want to spend more than 2 nights on the Chisos Mountains then this is a must have!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for high useage, very tough.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent heavy use filter. Tough, simple design and about 16 oz in weight. It filters out bad stuff and with a carbon inner filter makes water taste clean. This is my second MSR Miniworks, the first one lasted for years of tough use and abuse. The key for this filter's excellence is to clean it by back flushing(its in the directions and will help!). There are much smaller and lighter filters out there but for long term heavy use this gets an A+. Amazon shipped this very fast. Wow.
customer_reviews.author: Forest

customer_reviews.title: Glad I went with the MSR!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that I can stand up, drop my line down into my water source and pump. I don't have to crouch down to reach the water at an uncomfortable level, or put myself in an awkward position to collect water. The cord is plenty long, the device isn't too bulky, and it is easy to clean when you get back. Also like the fact that you can get replacement parts, should you need them, and a maintenance kit as well. The ceramic element makes it a little heavy, but the ease of use and performance are worth it. Just thread on your preferred water bottle and pump!
customer_reviews.author: E. Mason

customer_reviews.title: saved me a lot of weight
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a 5 day canoe/camping trip that had a couple of 1.5 mile rugged carry portages so I didnt want to lug anymore weight than i had to. Very nice and simple design, it was easy to setup and use. The water we were on was very clear so it was able to pump reasonably fast and i didnt have to clean the filter until i got home. I pumped about 2 gallons through it over the week. I bought the maintenance kit but did not go the extra step of a buying a spare filter yet. Tear down and cleaning was also simple.
customer_reviews.author: Justin L

product_meta.title: MSR MiniWorks EX Microfilter Water Filter
product_meta.description:
The MSR MiniWorks EX Microfilter Water Filter provides proven, reliable water filtration for camping and hiking, backcountry adventures, global travel, survival situations, and emergencies. The replaceable Marathon EX ceramic element removes bacteria (such as E. coli. Shigella, salmonella, cholera), protozoa (such as giardia, cryptosporidium, amoebae), and particulate, and its carbon core eliminates unpleasant tastes and odors caused by organic compounds such as iodine, chlorine, and pesticides. Thanks to its innovative AirSpring Accumulator, the microfilter is capable of pumping one liter of water per minute, a flow rate that is easily maintained in the field, without any tools. The MSR MiniWorks EX Microfilter meets NSF protocol P231 for removal of bacteria (99.9999%) and protozoa (99.9%), throughout its replaceable filter life of 2,000 liters of water. Compatible with a wide variety of water containers such as Nalgene, Camelback, and MSR Dromedary Bags (sold separately); bottom screws on to threaded lids, or water can be pumped directly into a hydration reservoir drinking tube. Lightweight and compact, the pump measures 7.5 x 2.75 inches and weighs one pound. A storage bag is included. Manufacturer’s limited lifetime warranty. Made in the USA.

AMAZON.COM


MSR MINIWORKS EX MICROFILTER
The MiniWorks EX microfilter from MSR is built to deliver long-lasting, field-maintainable water filtration in demanding environments. Engineered for frequent and heavy use, it utilizes MSR's workhorse Marathon EX carbon/ceramic element to ensure clean, reliable, and taste-free water. Thanks to its innovative AirSpring Accumulator, it’s capable of pumping one liter per minute and the flow rate can be renewed easily and repeatedly in the field with no tools required. It’s lightweight and compact and, most importantly, has been proven reliable by thousands of adventurers world wide.

KEY FEATURES:
 * Reliable: Durable carbon/ceramic element ensures safe, taste-free water—even with frequent, heavy use.
 * Field-maintainable: Can be cleaned repeatedly for full filter recovery with no tools required.
 * Fast Flow: AirSpring Accumulator increases filtration speed--up to 1-liter per minute.
 * Better-tasting Water: Carbon core removes unpleasant tastes and odors caused by organic compounds, such as iodine, chlorine, and pesticides.

 SPECIFICATIONS: 
 * Field cleanable and maintainable
 * Effective against: protozoa, bacteria, chemicals/toxins, and particulate
 * Not effective against viruses
 * Weight: 1 pound / 456 grams
 * Dimensions: 2.75 by 7.5 inches / 7 by 19 centimeters (WxL)
 * Filter media: Ceramic Plus Carbon
 * Filter pore size: 0.2 microns
 * Flow rate: 1 liter per minute
 * Flow (strokes per liter): 85
 * Cartridge life: ~2000 liters
 * Cartridge replacement indicator
 * Mechanical advantage
 * Water bottle adapter included
 * Made in Seattle, USA
 * Limited lifetime warranty
feature_bullets: Microfilter water filter pump for hiking, backpacking, camping, travel, survival, and emergency preparedness
Replaceable carbon and ceramic filter removes bacteria, protozoa, organic compounds, and particulate, delivering clean, taste and odor-free water
Pumps at a rate of one liter per minute; compatible with a variety of wide mouth water bottles, and hydration bladders (sold separately)
Meets NSF protocol P231 for removal of bacteria (99.9999%) and protozoa (99.9%); one replaceable filter cartridge treats up to 2,000 liters of water
Pump measures 7.5 x 2.75 inches and weighs 1 pound; storage bag included; manufacturer’s limited lifetime warranty; made in the USA

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
